This process, identification with models in
a group-learning situation, is predicated on
the idea that a child will respond emotionally
to stimuli, and that if he does, learning beÂ¬
comes truly meaningful for him. This process
is discussed technically, later in this paper
(see Section 8). The theory is not a complicated
one, it says: what the individual can see in his
own "Line of Sight" that is positive, reinforcing,
he may identify with, and that if he can see
these things often enough, and if he can, himself,
succeed often enough, he will come to believe in
his own ability to achieve, come to believe in his
own worth as an individual.
Through the application of our most successful
experiences with mass communications media, we
can confront the poverty population more hopefully
than ever before.
